title: Diabetes Resource Center

sections.heading: 1 of 9 / Overview & Types
content: Diabetes is a number of diseases that involve problems with the hormone insulin. There is no cure for diabetes.
There are three major types of diabetes: type 1 diabetes, type 2 diabetes, and gestational diabetes.
Diabetes insipidus causes you to have an almost unquenchable thirst and your body to make a lot of urine.
Gestational DI, or gestagenic diabetes insipidus, is a rare disorder that happens in pregnancy, usually in the third trimester.
bullets: What Is Diabetes? Diabetes is a number of diseases that involve problems with the hormone insulin. There is no cure for diabetes.
What Are the Different Types of Diabetes? There are three major types of diabetes: type 1 diabetes, type 2 diabetes, and gestational diabetes.
What Is Diabetes Insipidus? Diabetes insipidus causes you to have an almost unquenchable thirst and your body to make a lot of urine.
What Is Gestagenic Diabetes Insipidus? Gestational DI, or gestagenic diabetes insipidus, is a rare disorder that happens in pregnancy, usually in the third trimester.

sections.heading: 2 of 9 / Symptoms & Diagnosis
content: The warning signs of diabetes can be so mild that you don't notice them. That's especially true of type 2 diabetes.
Diabetes diagnostic tests include a fasting plasma glucose test, oral glucose tolerance test, or random plasma glucose test.
An oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT) shows how well your body handles sugar from foods.
The hemoglobin A1c test is an important blood test that shows how well your diabetes is being controlled.
bullets: Signs & Symptoms of Diabetes The warning signs of diabetes can be so mild that you don't notice them. That's especially true of type 2 diabetes.

Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) Testing The hemoglobin A1c test is an important blood test that shows how well your diabetes is being controlled.

sections.heading: 3 of 9 / Treatment
content: You cannot treat diabetes on your own. Your doctor will help you make a diabetes treatment plan that is right for you.
Different doctors can help you manage different aspects of your diabetes. Find out who you need on your team.
Many forms of insulin treat diabetes, including rapid-acting, short-acting, intermediate-acting, long-acting, and pre-mixed.

Toujeo is an injectable insulin medication for the treatment of diabetes (type 1 or type 2) in people who are 6 years old and older. It is a long-acting form of insulin, which allows it to last for a long time in the body to help control blood sugars.
bullets: Understanding Your Diabetes Treatment Options You cannot treat diabetes on your own. Your doctor will help you make a diabetes treatment plan that is right for you.
Your Diabetes Care Team Different doctors can help you manage different aspects of your diabetes. Find out who you need on your team.

Toujeo Insulin for Type 2 Diabetes Toujeo is an injectable insulin medication for the treatment of diabetes (type 1 or type 2) in people who are 6 years old and older. It is a long-acting form of insulin, which allows it to last for a long time in the body to help control blood sugars.

sections.heading: 4 of 9 / Living With
content: Blood sugar control is at the center of any diabetes treatment plan. High blood sugar, or hyperglycemia, is a major concern.
People with diabetes get hypoglycemia (low blood sugar) when their bodies don't have enough sugar to use as fuel.
Continuous glucose monitors are FDA-approved systems that track your blood sugar levels day and night.
Most people with diabetes need to check their glucose levels regularly. The results help you and your doctor manage those levels.
bullets: High Blood Sugar (Hyperglycemia) Blood sugar control is at the center of any diabetes treatment plan. High blood sugar, or hyperglycemia, is a major concern.
Low Blood Sugar (Hypoglycemia) People with diabetes get hypoglycemia (low blood sugar) when their bodies don't have enough sugar to use as fuel.
Continuous Glucose Monitoring Continuous glucose monitors are FDA-approved systems that track your blood sugar levels day and night.
How and When to Test Your Blood Sugar Most people with diabetes need to check their glucose levels regularly. The results help you and your doctor manage those levels.

sections.heading: 5 of 9 / Related Conditions
content: Nerve pain caused by diabetes, known as diabetic peripheral neuropathy, can be severe, constant, and hard to treat.
Skin conditions related to diabetes are common. Most can be successfully treated before they turn into a serious problem.
Diabetic nephropathy -- kidney disease that results from diabetes -- is the No. 1 cause of kidney failure.
Most infections in people with diabetes can be treated. But you have to be able to spot the symptoms. Learn what to look for.

sections.heading: 6 of 9 / Type 2 Diabetes
content: Type 2 diabetes is a lifelong disease that keeps your body from using insulin the way it should.
Prediabetes is when your blood sugar level is higher than it should be but not enough for your doctor to diagnose diabetes.
Insulin resistance is when cells in your muscles, fat, and liver don’t respond well to insulin.
You might not know that you have type 2 diabetes until it affects your health. Symptoms can come on slowly.
bullets: What Is Type 2 Diabetes? Type 2 diabetes is a lifelong disease that keeps your body from using insulin the way it should.
Prediabetes (Borderline Diabetes) Prediabetes is when your blood sugar level is higher than it should be but not enough for your doctor to diagnose diabetes.
What is Insulin Resistance? Insulin resistance is when cells in your muscles, fat, and liver don’t respond well to insulin.
Early Signs and Symptoms of Type 2 Diabetes You might not know that you have type 2 diabetes until it affects your health. Symptoms can come on slowly.

sections.heading: 7 of 9 / Type 1 Diabetes
content: Type 1 diabetes is a condition in which your immune system destroys insulin-making cells in your pancreas.
Know the symptoms of type 1 diabetes so you can help keep your child healthy.
For those with diabetes, an insulin shot delivers medicine into the subcutaneous tissue.
It's important to eat a healthy diet when you have type 1 diabetes. That doesn't mean you can't enjoy tasty food.
bullets: Type 1 Diabetes Type 1 diabetes is a condition in which your immune system destroys insulin-making cells in your pancreas.
Might My Child Have Type 1 Diabetes? Know the symptoms of type 1 diabetes so you can help keep your child healthy.
Giving Yourself an Insulin Shot for Diabetes For those with diabetes, an insulin shot delivers medicine into the subcutaneous tissue.
What to Eat When You Have Type 1 Diabetes It's important to eat a healthy diet when you have type 1 diabetes. That doesn't mean you can't enjoy tasty food.

sections.heading: 8 of 9 / Gestational Diabetes
content: Gestational diabetes is high blood sugar that you get only when you're pregnant.
Although some things mean you're more likely to get gestational diabetes, you can steps to lower your risk.
All pregnant women should be screened for gestational diabetes during their pregnancy.
If you have gestational diabetes, you'll need to get your blood sugar under control to protect your health and your baby's.
bullets: What Causes Gestational Diabetes? Gestational diabetes is high blood sugar that you get only when you're pregnant.
Gestational Diabetes: Can I Lower My Risk? Although some things mean you're more likely to get gestational diabetes, you can steps to lower your risk.
Pregnancy and Gestational Diabetes Screening All pregnant women should be screened for gestational diabetes during their pregnancy.
How Is Gestational Diabetes Treated? If you have gestational diabetes, you'll need to get your blood sugar under control to protect your health and your baby's.

sections.heading: Suggested Reads about Diabetes
content: Learn what mistakes you should avoid if you have diabetes and what to do to manage your blood sugar.
Do you think your blood sugars are out of control? WebMD shows you the signs that you should look for.
If managing your type 2 diabetes is overwhelming, there’s help available to get you back on track. Take control with these tips.
Eating out and keeping your blood sugar in check can be challenging. Here are a few ways to avoid overindulging.
